cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 785 miles ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then northwest between Bermuda and the Bahamas and expected to slow and approach the North or South Carolina coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina/South Carolina (around Cape Fear–Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of the NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light, VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings from South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Carolina and southern Mid-Atlantic coasts with inland extension toward the southern Appalachians
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of experiencing sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible late weekend
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for NY/NJ harbor; surge threat confined to the Carolinas
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer moisture may bring 1–3 inches of rain to the NY/NJ region late weekend into early next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along NJ and Long Island beaches beginning mid-week
